lane module

class lane.Lane[source]

Bases: object

Description: object containing all of the information about a lane

directionFlow

an array of the VPH of traffic for each direction [LeftVPH, StraightVPH, RightVPH]

Type:

array(int)

totalFlow

the total VPH of traffic for the direction

Type:

int

lastCarTime

the time that the last vehicle entered the lane whilst running the direction

Type:

float

avgWait

the average wait of a vehicle in this lane between entering and leaving the lane

Type:

float

maxQueue

the longest queue of vehicles in this lane

Type:

int

maxWait

the longest wait of a vehicle in this lane

Type:

float

numCarsPassed

the number of vehicles that have passed through this lane

Type:

int

cars

the queue of vehicle objects

Type:

Queue(Vehicle)

newCarRate

how long is takes for a car to enter the lane

Type:

float

lightTime

the time that the light of this lane will be on for

Type:

float

totalWait

the total wait time of all vehicles in this lane

Type:

float

getQueueSize(self)[source]

gives the size of the queue in the lane

updateDirectionFlow(self, flow, flowType, updateType)[source]

Sets the flow of the lane and the newCarRate based on the new flow

getQueueSize()[source]

Description: Returns the size of the queue of cars in the lane

Parameters:

self (Lane) – the lane in question

Returns:

the number of vehicles in the lane’s queue

Return type:

int

updateDirectionFlow(flow, flowType, updateType)[source]

Description: Sets the flow of the lane and the newCarRate based on the new flow

Parameters:

  • flow (int) – the VPH that is being updated

  • flowType (int) – which direction the flow is heading (0 = Left, 1 = Straight, 2 = Right)

  • updateType (string) – how the update should occur (‘add’ = add the flow to the current flow, ‘sub’ = subtract the flow from the current flow, ‘rep’ = replace the current flow with the new flow)

lane.laneOrdering(lanes)[source]

Description: Orders the array of lanes into the correct order

Parameters:

lanes (Array) – an array representing the lanes of a junction direction.

Returns:

the lanes of a junction direction, with the lanes in the correct order from left to right.

Return type:

array
